file_content.text: Valkorion. We need to talk.
Talking is your greatest talent. It is time I taught you when to listen.
You saw that mission briefing. You know what's at stake.
This is no time to argue.
I am not your servant--and you have trifled with my patience for the last time.
Lana, come in. Something happened. I need your help.
Your friends cannot hear you.
I don't have time for your insanity! I have a mission on Zakuul!
I'm sick of you! Let me go!
You may still go... if you survive.
You have forgotten what it means to face death alone. I will remind you.
Jedi and their consultations. In too many ways, you remain bound to that order.
Your life is defined by deeds, not words--and we have nothing to discuss.
You once claimed the mantle of my Wrath. Now look at you... begging for my scraps.
Do not presume to manipulate me. We are not Sith, and the Dark Council is dead.
When you kneeled before me, I thought you would become my greatest ally. How wrong I was, to believe that.
I built an Alliance to punish Arcann for what he's done. I've honored our bargain. It's time you did the same.
I could say the same thing.
You took my power, and now come for my secrets. But you have not earned them.
Your help is worthless if I can't stop Arcann's fleet. Show me how to do that.
I'm offering you victory.
Time and again, you reject my aid. Why would I trust you with secrets you have not earned?
You always knew what controlled the Eternal Fleet. You should've told me.
You've been holding out on me.
I refused your power because I know it isn't worth the price. You're proving me right.
Fine, I don't need you.
Theron, it's me. Something's wrong. I need backup.
Koth, do you read? There's trouble. I need you.
You brought me here. Why?
You isolated me for a reason.
Sometimes, evolution requires a push. Or a sacrifice.
What is this? Another illusion?
Am I having another dream?
The time for fantasy is over. What happens now is quite real.
